title: Giovanna Tantini 2016  Bardolino Chiaretto
description: Enticing aromas of wild berry, spring blossom, citrus and orchard fruit take center stage on this savory rosato. The vibrant palate doles out crushed raspberry, juicy Marasca cherry, fennel seed and a hint of nutmeg alongside refreshing acidity. It closes crisp and clean.

title: Goodfellow 2014 Bishop Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: All the right components are in place here, but not yet entirely melded into a complete whole. Stem, earth, nettles and somewhat submerged cherry flavors are in the mix. The finish brings a seam of caramel, and a bit of a back-throat burn.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Shy notes on the nose hint at ripe yellow pear. The palate, on the other hand, is characterized more by pithy citrus than by juicy pear. There is a pleasantly bitter edge and a dry grapefruit-spicy finish.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: A touch of flinty reduction still clings to the nose. The palate has very lively, almost fizzy freshness characterized entirely by fresh lemon. This is light, dry, easy and very refreshing—just made for a sunny day.

title: Cellars 33 2016 Clay Station Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Borden Ranch)
description: This tasty, balanced wine is leaner than some of its peers. Green apple and white peach aromas lead to apple and light citrus flavors. The crisp acidity lines up nicely, making it a versatile partner for food.

title: Acquiesce 2016 Grenache Blanc (Lodi)
description: Floral aromas and peachy flavors give this dry wine an exotic, tropical character while not being too overt about it. Medium body and tangy acidity help bring a pleasant balance and an appetizing, mouthwatering texture. It's one of several nice light-bodied whites from winemaker Sue Tipton.

title: Baily 2013 Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: At first, this wine from one of the region's pioneering producers seems superripe, with blueberry and black plum fruit, but then come waves of more complex mint, chocolate and Christmas spice. The tannins are soft yet provide ample structure to the berry compote and clove spice flavors.

title: Bonterra 2014 Merlot (Mendocino County)
description: Salt and pepper aromas, full body and a meaty flavor give this wine a bold personality that's fun to experience. Firm tannins add grip to the layered mouthfeel, while ripe cherry and blackberry fruit provides a counterpoint to the spicy character. 45% new oak and the addition of Rhône varieties help amp up the spiciness.

title: Bulgariana 2014 Pinot Noir (Danube River Plains)
description: This Pinot Noir has delightful aromas of tart cherry, cotton candy, dried violet and powdered cocoa. On the palate there are flavors of pomegranate, fresh cherry, dried Mediterranean herbs and milk chocolate. It is well balanced, with a pleasant splash of acidity in the finish.

title: Château Platon 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: From a four-acre mostly Sauvignon Blanc vineyard, Jean-Francois Meynard has produced a light, bright and fruity wine. Crisp and mineral driven, it comes with a touch of spice and almonds that adds interest and complexity to this already-complete wine. Drink now.

title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2016 Cuvée Passion  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This wine has a good balance between spice and ripe yellow and apple fruits. The taut, mineral texture will allow it to age well. Touches of toast support the rich fruits. Drink from late 2017.

title: Deer Creek 2014 Private Reserve Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: Medium weight and nicely focused, this brings spicy fruit flavors of cranberry and cherry into play. There's ample tart acidity, and aging 16 months in 42% new French oak has not turned it into a walk through a lumber yard.

title: Edi Simcic 2012 Sauvignon (Goriska Brda)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc has pronounced aromas of lemongrass and caramelized apple. In the mouth it is creamy and balanced, with flavors of vanilla and buttery pie crust.

title: Gustave Lorentz 2016 Le Rosé (Alsace)
description: This pale rosé does not give much away on the nose. On its slender palate, it shows spicy, almost savory notes of red currant and a touch of strawberry. This is refreshing, dry and light-bodied, with a wonderfully clean finish.

title: Lucien Albrecht 2016 Réserve Riesling (Alsace)
description: Notes of freshly cut lemon on the nose turn into fully fledged, almost fizzy lemon freshness on the palate. This is fruit-driven, easy but ever so refreshing. With its fizzing lightness, this almost is like a lemon spritzer. Utterly refreshing and dry.

title: K Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: Aromas of cinnamon, powdered nutmeg and black cherry lead into a palate with flavors of black cherry, candied violet, dried cherry and finely ground black pepper. This wine has medium body, nice mouthfeel and a persistent finish accented by a touch of lively fruit acidity.

title: Ignacio Marín 2012 Marín Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Ripe raisin, vanilla, tobacco and cassis aromas are more than adequately oaked. This feels grippy and bold, with an oak-based resiny mouthfeel. Toasty blueberry and blackberry flavors finish with a final note of oak and heat.

title: Gooseneck 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Gooseneck is based in Rhode Island but sources wines from around the world. This Pinot was produced at River's Edge, in the Elkton Oregon AVA—a good start. It's a delicious bottle, with flavors of oranges and cherries streaked with cola. The aromatics are spot-on, and the wine delivers terrific pleasure for the price.

title: Finca Patagonia 2013 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)
description: Ripe berry aromas show a note of prune as well as mocha and vanilla scents. Tight clampy tannins roughen up the mouthfeel on this Maule Cabernet, while a fairly heavy wood element blends with flavors of herbal berry fruits and beef jerky. This is a full-volume wine with a full-volume finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Maquis 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)
description: Raw woodsy spicy plum and black-fruit aromas feed into a grabby lively palate with tough rubbery tannins. This tastes dark and heavily oaked, with baked berry, spice and chocolate flavors. A long toasty fully oaked finish is rough-and-tumble in feel but thorough. Drink through 2021.

title: Noviello 2014 Quintessence Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of baking spice, woodspice and dark fruit are followed by sweet, wood-heavy fruit flavors that show a fair amount of tannic grip. The cranberry accents bring appeal but the wood is pretty primary.

title: Record Family Wines 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: A great effort for the estate's inaugural white, this expertly restrained Viognier hails from a region where the grape tends toward overripeness. Crisp apple blossoms, daffodil, white peach and chalk aromas give way to a mellow palate of pear, apple, nectarine and jasmine-like flavors.

title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Pouco Comum Alvarinho (Minho)
description: Because this producer is in the southern Minho region, away from the northern Alvarinho vineyards, the wine is registered as Minho rather than Vinho Verde. But it has the same fine fruit and creamy richness that is typical of this grape. It could age a little longer, so wait until late 2017.

title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Alvarinho (Minho)
description: The wine is rich and full of ripe white and citrus fruits. It has a sense of concentration from the tense mineral fruitiness and full mouthfeel. This wine is still a little young and will be better from the end of 2017.

title: Skinner 2015 Grenache Blanc (El Dorado)
description: Rich in texture but lean in fruit flavor, this medium-bodied wine relies on a buttery aroma and flavor to carry its weight while light apple cider and crisp melon notes add interest. The mouthfeel is nicely viscous, which contributes to a lingering finish.

title: Skinner 2015 Viognier (El Dorado)
description: This wine's prominent buttery aromas grab one's attention right away, and that same buttery element runs through the flavors and lingers on the finish. The fruit components are mild and melon-like, the body is medium and the texture reveals good acidity.

title: Seven Hills 2014 Carmenère (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas don't hold back, with strong varietal notes of jalapeño and freshly cut green pepper along with cherry and hot-spice accents. The palate brings more of the same with light, tart, bright fruit flavors. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.

title: Sola 2013 Meritage (California)
description: Fruity, savory and lightly oaky flavors are supported by moderate tannins in this medium-bodied and well-balanced blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Mint, cedar and thyme aromas give way to red cherry, raspberry and sage flavors on the palate, and the mouthfeel strikes a balance between suppleness and a light tannic bite.

title: Terra d'Oro 2015 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine from one of Amador County's legendary vineyards is structured, oaky and pleasantly dry. Toasty, peppery, grilled aromas and straightforward blackberry and raspberry fruit flavors are backed by firm tannins and acidity, lending the palate appetizing bite. While this vintage tastes tighter than the last two, expect it to mellow through 2020 at least.

title: Vie di Romans 2015 Vieris Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)
description: This opens with aromas of bread crust, citrus zest and a whiff of crushed aromatic herb. Aged on its lees in barriques, the medium-bodied palate offers toasted oak, mature yellow apple, candied lemon drop and a hint of bitter almond.
